intro: Roureopsis emarginata, commonly known as the emarginate roureopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while the flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
